double_jeopardy.category: STAR TALK WITH NEIL deGRASSE TYSON

clues.category: STAR TALK WITH NEIL deGRASSE TYSON
clues.clue: (Neil deGrasse Tyson shows an astronomical animation on the monitor.) Our GPS satellites experience less gravity than we do here on Earth's surface so their clocks tick a bit faster... but engineers pre-correct the GPS time for Einstein's general theory of this

clues.category: STAR TALK WITH NEIL deGRASSE TYSON
clues.clue: (Neil deGrasse Tyson shows an astronomical animation on the monitor.) This planet is in the sun's habitable zone, but thick clouds of carbon dioxide trap solar radiation making it the hottest in our solar system

clues.category: STAR TALK WITH NEIL deGRASSE TYSON
clues.clue: (Neil deGrasse Tyson shows some astronomical imagery on the monitor.) More than 90% of the atoms in the cosmos are of this element &, as part of Jupiter's core, it behaves like a metal, giving the planet its immense magnetic field

clues.category: STAR TALK WITH NEIL deGRASSE TYSON
clues.clue: (Neil deGrasse Tyson demonstrates by bending a piece of paper.) Involving the folding or warping of both space & time, future space travel could be aided by theoretical shortcuts called Einstein-Rosen bridges, AKA these
